result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl Wesley Jr.

records.addlTxt: THE SULTON LAW FIRM LLC, by Attorney William F. Sulton

Defendant Carl Wesley Jr. not in court.  Attorney William F Sulton in court for Carl Wesley Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Offer received. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed by the end of the week. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Carl Wesley Jr. not in court.  Attorney William F Sulton in court for Carl Wesley Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Signature bond set. Needs to be signed by the end of the day, 8-23-2022. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial appearance on August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
